smell_analysis.justification: All diagrams in the provided PDF contain elements; no empty diagrams were found.
All use cases in the 'Väljakute funktsionaalne allsüsteem' diagram are associated with an actor, either directly or via an «include» relationship to a use case that is associated with an actor.
No use cases with identical names were found associated with the same actor.
No packages were found containing multiple model elements with the same name.
No redundant data storage (denormalization) without foreign keys was detected in the database schema diagrams.
All use cases follow a consistent naming convention, starting with a verb (e.g., 'Tuvasta', 'Vaata', 'Lõpeta', 'Registreeri').
In the state diagram (Väljaku seisundidiagramm), all states (Ootel, Aktiivne, Mitteaktiivne, Unustatud, Lõpetatud) are reachable via transitions.
In the activity diagrams (Väljaku lõpetamise/aktiveerimise tegevusdiagramm), all actions are reachable from the start node.
All class and database associations display multiplicity indicators (e.g., 1, 0..*, 0..1) at both ends where relationships are visually represented.
The use case diagram 'Väljakute funktsionaalne allsüsteem' (Page 2) contains 11 use cases (central elements), which exceeds the threshold of 10.
No single class or table was found with 6 or more visual connection lines on a single diagram page. The maximum observed was 5 (e.g., on the 'Väljak' table in the transformed register diagram).
The layout of the diagrams is balanced, and no related elements are placed at excessive distances compared to the average.
All use cases and activity actions start with an active verb (e.g., 'Vaata', 'Otsi', 'Vali', 'Aktiveeri').
No classes, tables, attributes, or use cases were found with names of 3 characters or less. (Shortest found were 4 characters, e.g., 'Isik', 'Riik', 'kood').
All class names start with an uppercase letter and are singular (e.g., 'Isik', 'Klient', 'Väljak').
All attributes and column names start with a lowercase letter (e.g., 'eesnimi', 'nimetus', 'on_aktiivne').
All table names in the transformed diagrams are singular (e.g., 'Isik', 'Klient', 'Väljak').
No Hungarian notation or type prefixes (like 'tbl_', 'str') were found in element names.
